answers.author: Katie Wilken
answers.text:
We define family as:
a. An individual; or
b. two or more persons, including children, related by blood, marriage, or adoption living together as a single housekeeping unit in a dwelling; or
c. No more than six persons not related, living together as a single housekeeping unit; or
D. Persons with development disabilities and operators of a residential facility living together as a single housekeeping unit.
We don't define housekeeping unit further but typically sharing a kitchen is what is key. The key is to make sure your definition does not violate the Fair Housing Law. Unrelated protected classes (i.e. persons with disabilities) should not be treated unfairly compared with blood-related families.  Precedence has generally been set that 6 unrelated persons is the lowest reasonable limit to set on a unit.
"A Planners Dictionary" put out by APA is a great resource when creating definitions for your Zoning Ordinance. http://www.planning.org/apastore/Search/Default.aspx?p=2431
Also check out the Census definitions, they can be helpful.
